THE RISK OF MONEY LAUNDERING

Page

Table of Contents

 

The next step is to classify the risk posed by the type of designated service the customer seeks to acquire. Designated service types include:

 

Click on the terms below for more details

Other account types that could be classified as potentially high risk include accounts where the customer requests to be exempted from normal reporting activity and accounts with an unknown purpose or anticipated activity.

Asset finance products carry low ML/TF risk.  In this case no funds are advanced to the customer but are paid into a supplier's bank account to fund the purchase of an asset that is made available under contract to the customer. Repayments by the customer are usually made from other bank accounts by direct debit. Any ML/TF risk arises through the acceleration of an agreed repayment schedule, either by means of lump sum repayments, or early termination.

Accounts offering this should be considered medium risk as they can be exploited for placement of illegally obtained funds.

Accounts where unlimited third party funds can be readily received, or funds can be readily paid to third parties, should be considered medium risk.

These should be considered higher risk than non-trust accounts since the identity of each true beneficiary of a trust account may not be known.
